body:
Thanks for the feedback! If your issue is related to the Flutter framework itself,
please open an issue at
[github.com/flutter/flutter](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/new).

## Steps to Reproduce

1. had a test  test('Unauthenticated access', () async {..
2. Click "Run test.."
3. IDE reported it couldn't find the flutter SDK
4. Rename the test to something like  test('XXUnauthenticated access', () async {
and it works ok. 




## Version info
C:\bin\flutter\bin\flutter.bat doctor --verbose
[√] Flutter (Channel stable, v1.12.13+hotfix.8, on Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.18363.720], locale en-NZ)
    • Flutter version 1.12.13+hotfix.8 at C:\bin\flutter
    • Framework revision 0b8abb4724 (7 weeks ago), 2020-02-11 11:44:36 -0800
    • Engine revision e1e6ced81d
    • Dart version 2.7.0


---


## Version information

Android Studio `3.6.1` • Flutter plugin `io.flutter 44.0.2` • Dart plugin `192.7761`

Error getting Flutter sdk information.

## Exception

null


comment_data.body: Thanks for the report! I believe this may have been fixed by https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/pull/4437.

title: Error getting Flutter SDK information when running tests in AndroidStudio
